intro: Saxifraga marshallii var. divaricata, commonly known as the Divaricata saxifrage, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Eastern Himalayas. It typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. The plant features upright, branched stems with opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are usually covered in a dense layer of white or gray pubescence. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and are typically pink to purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in rock gardens and alpine settings.
